author: Tim Gross - The Sentinel, Carlisle, Pa. (TNS)
title: Brandon Lyons makes Paralympic debut in H3 individual time trials | Olympics | lancasteronline.com
text: Sep. 4‚ÄîBrandon Lyons, a handcyclist from Mechanicsburg, made his Paralympic debut Wednesday, finishing 10th in the men's H3 individual time trials in the Paris suburbs. Lyons covered the two laps of the 14.1-kilometer course in 49 minutes, 34.02 seconds, a little more than six minutes off the pace set by France's Mathieu Bosredon, who won gold at 43:33.22. France's Johan Quaile took second place (45:33.41) while Martino Pini of Italy claimed bronze (46:13.69). Lyons, who graduated from Cumberland Valley High School and Penn State University, suffered a spinal injury in May 2014 and took up handcycling to remain active after his injury. In 2017, he participated in a full-time residency program at the U.S. Olympic and Paralympic Training Center in Colorado Springs, Colorado, and developed sepsis just before the Team USA qualifying event for the Tokyo Games in 2021. Lyons' maiden voyage through the Paralympics is set to continue with the men's H3 road race scheduled for Thursday morning. Tim Gross is the sports editor at The Sentinel and cumberlink.com . Email him at tgross@cumberlink.com and follow him on Twitter at: @ByTimGross (c)2024 The Sentinel (Carlisle, Pa.) Visit The Sentinel (Carlisle, Pa.) at www.cumberlink.com Distributed by Tribune Content Agency, LLC.

author: Aaron Bandler
title: Biden Admin Temporarily Suspends UNRWA Funding Over Allegations of Staffers Involved in Oct. 7 Massacre
text:
The Biden administration is temporarily suspending funding to the United Nations Relief and Works Agency (UNRWA) after the U.N. agency announced that they were terminating multiple staffers over their alleged involvement in the Oct. 7 massacre.
Jewish Insider reported that State Department spokesperson Matthew Miller said in a statement, ‚ÄúThe United States is extremely troubled by the allegations that twelve UNRWA employees may have been involved in the October 7 Hamas terrorist attack on Israel. The Department of State has temporarily paused additional funding for UNRWA while we review these allegations and the steps the United Nations is taking to address them.‚Äù
UNRWA itself issued a press release on Friday stating that they are investigating the allegations and that ‚Äúany UNRWA employee who was involved in acts of terror will be held accountable, including through criminal prosecution. UNRWA reiterates its condemnation in the strongest possible terms of the abhorrent attacks of 7 Oct. and calls for the immediate and unconditional release of all Israeli hostages and their safe return to their families.‚Äù
The U.S. is one of 19 countries (and the European Union) that have suspended funding to UNRWA over the allegations, including the United Kingdom, European Union and Australia. Eylon Levy, spokesperson for the Israeli Prime Minister‚Äôs Office, argued in a Tuesday press briefing that UNRWA needs to be scrapped altogether, claiming that Israeli intelligence has found that ‚Äúabout 10% [of UNRWA employees] are Hamas or Islamic Jihad operatives, and another 50% are first-degree relatives of a Hamas operative.‚Äù
However, White House National Security Council spokesperson John Kirby contended to reporters on Monday, ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs not impugn the good work of a whole agency because of the potential bad actions here by a small number.‚Äù He pointed out that UNRWA has 13,000 employees in Gaza that only 13 so far were allegedly involved in Oct. 7.
UN Watch Executive Director Hillel Neuer posted on X to U.N. Secretary-General Ant√≥nio Guterres, ‚ÄúToday you said you were ‚Äòhorrified‚Äô at the news UNRWA staff were implicated in Hamas terrorism. But every time we sounded the alarm about UNRWA employees and terrorism, your office disparaged us. You can‚Äôt say you didn‚Äôt know. You knew.‚Äù He also posted on X that UN Watch obtained a copy of a Telegram chat consisting of 3,000 UNRWA staffers that is ‚Äúreplete with celebrations of Hamas terrorism.‚Äù ‚ÄúThere is not one case where an UNRWA teacher objected,‚Äù he added.
Mr. Secretary General @antonioguterres : Today you said you were ‚Äúhorrified‚Äù at the news UNRWA staff were implicated in Hamas terrorism. But every time we sounded the alarm about UNRWA employees and terrorism, your office disparaged us. You can't say you didn't know. You knew. üßµ https://t.co/KecOpm8MLp
‚Äî Hillel Neuer (@HillelNeuer) January 26, 2024
Just a few bad apples?
Here is our saved copy of the UNRWA Telegram group of 3,000 UNRWA teachers: https://t.co/1FgUu9Lxvo
There are 249,000 messages, replete with celebrations of Hamas terrorism: https://t.co/1avingQHvp
There is not one case where an UNRWA teacher objected.
‚Äî Hillel Neuer (@HillelNeuer) January 28, 2024
Foundation for Defense of Democracies (FDD) Senior Advisor Richard Goldberg declared in congressional testimony on Tuesday before the House Foreign Affairs Committee that ‚ÄúUNRWA has a terrorism problem, and the U.S. taxpayer has been underwriting it for decades.‚Äù ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve seen the reports of Hamas terror tunnels discovered next to or under UNRWA schools,‚Äù said Goldberg. ‚ÄúAnd not just since Oct. 7. I‚Äôm including here footnotes for stories about these tunnels in 2017, 2021 and 2022. We‚Äôve seen the social media accounts of UNRWA employees supporting terrorism and antisemitism‚Ä¶ And we‚Äôve even .seen the report of a released hostage who was held in the attic of an UNRWA teacher‚Äôs home. These aren‚Äôt new phenomena. We‚Äôve seen UNRWA schools used as rocket-launching platforms ‚Äî and rockets even stored inside UNRWA schools. We‚Äôve seen an UNRWA school headmaster moonlighting as an Islamic Jihad terrorist.‚Äù
Further, Goldberg pointed out that there‚Äôs a ‚Äúhotbed of terrorism that grows inside UNRWA‚Äôs communities ‚Äî not just in Gaza but in the West Bank and Lebanon. Look at the Jenin Refugee Camp in the West Bank where Israel continues to operate to defend Israelis against Hamas and other terror cells. Look at Lebanon‚Äôs Ain al-Hilweh refugee camp, where terrorist groups continue to battle each other ‚Äî with no Israeli presence or military activity whatsoever. At least 28 people dead in two rounds of fighting with so many families, including children, displaced ‚Ä¶ an underreported story. Do we see the pattern here?‚Äù
He argued that UNRWA‚Äôs ‚Äúterror problem‚Äù is structural, as the U.N. ‚Äúdoes not recognize Hamas, Islamic Jihad, Hezbollah, or the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine (PFLP) as terrorist groups.‚Äù
UNRWA told CNN on Monday regarding claims from Israel that UNRWA facilities were used for terror, ‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt have more information on this at this stage. The Office of Internal Oversight Services (the internal oversight body of the U.N.) will look into all these allegations as part of the investigation the Commissioner General of UNRWA has requested them to undertake.‚Äù
Jewish groups praised the Biden administration‚Äôs decision to pause UNRWA funding.
‚ÄúTime and again, we‚Äôve seen how this UN agency is often more involved with Hamas terrorists than with supporting the Palestinian people,‚Äù the Anti-Defamation League (ADL) posted to X.
We welcome the US's decision to suspend funding to #UNRWA after learning of 12 employees involved in the Oct 7 massacre. Time and again, we've seen how this UN agency is often more involved with Hamas terrorists than with supporting the Palestinian people. https://t.co/HbEqAokr5I
‚Äî ADL (@ADL) January 26, 2024
The American Jewish Committee also posted to X, ‚ÄúAJC is livid to learn of the allegations that twelve UNRWA employees may have been involved in the Oct. 7 massacre. We welcome the announcement by the @StateDept that it has paused all additional funding for UNRWA and will launch a full investigation into the allegations. There must be accountability.‚Äù
AJC is livid to learn of the allegations that twelve UNRWA employees may have been involved in the October 7 massacre.
We welcome the announcement by the @StateDept that it has paused all additional funding for UNRWA and will launch a full investigation into the allegations.‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/M9Qo4XBvZS
‚Äî American Jewish Committee (@AJCGlobal) January 26, 2024
Simon Wiesenthal Center Associate Dean and Director of Global Social Action Agenda Rabbi Abraham Cooper also said in a statement, ‚Äú‚ÄúAs I told U.S. Secretary of State Blinken recently‚ÄîUNRWA cannot be relied upon to be part of the solution in Gaza the day after this war ends, it is a core problem of what‚Äôs wrong with Gaza. UNRWA should be scrapped and replaced with a new Palestinian entity that would be established and funded based on a commitment to peace and with full vetting of possible terrorist affiliation of any staff and teachers, an actual peace curriculum taught in Palestinian schools, and with total financial transparency monitored directly by donor nations.‚Äù
Democratic Majority for Israel President and CEO Mark Mellman said in a statement, ‚ÄúUN employees are required to be neutral in politics and to avoid criminal activity. UNRWA and its employees have long violated those principles. That UNRWA employees actively participated in savage terrorism is a deplorable and permanent stain on the U.N. and on UNRWA. Providing humanitarian aid to Palestinians is a vital objective, but it must be done in a way that doesn‚Äôt support terrorism.
‚Äú We welcome the announcement by the @StateDept that it has paused all additional funding for UNRWA and will launch a full investigation into the allegations. There must be accountability.‚Äù ‚Äì American Jewish Committee
‚ÄúDMFI has regularly called for reforming UNRWA, which in addition to providing humanitarian aid has long incited hatred and violence,‚Äù continued Mellman. ‚ÄúThrough its statements and actions, UNRWA has become a serious obstacle to peace. We now find that its employees also participate in mass murder, torture, and kidnapping. Donors must insist on a complete overhaul and reform of UNRWA. We urge the Administration to make the current pause the beginning of that root-and-branch remaking of this agency which is badly off track.‚Äù
Lawfare Project Founder and Executive Director Brooke Goldstein said in a statement, ‚ÄúWe have long been warning about the complicity of UNRWA in terrorist activity, starting with the schools they run, which are used by Hamas to indoctrinate and recruit children, to the active involvement of their staff in violent and murderous terrorist activities. The Trump administration had, appropriately, ceased funding to this entity, but the Biden administration restored it, despite well-known concerns about its activities. Now, we are pleased to see that many governments are waking up once again to the fact that their financial aid is being used to fund terrorism, not to help people.‚Äù
She continued: ‚ÄúBy granting Palestinians hereditary refugee status and making them dependent upon the United Nations, the Western world has effectively colonized them, depriving them of the opportunity ‚Äî and ability ‚Äî to integrate into the societies in which they live, or to develop the infrastructure and economy of areas that they control. And with terror organizations like Hamas running Gaza, there is no chance that the civilian population will ever be able to benefit from the tremendous economic partnerships available with Israel, the Middle East, and the rest of the world. UNRWA is a highly flawed organization that is incapable of being reformed; it needs to be dismantled and Hamas eliminated in order for the people of Gaza to be able to not just live freely, but to develop a healthy, free economy and evolve into a true partner on the global stage.‚Äù
Combat Antisemitism Movement Chief of Staff Arthur Maserjian said in a statement regarding Tuesday‚Äôs congressional hearing, ‚ÄúToday‚Äôs hearing only confirmed what we have known for a long time, that UNRWA will never be a partner who can be trusted to live up to its purpose of serving the welfare of the Palestinian people. It is now abundantly clear to all that funding UNWRA means funding terrorism, and this runs counter to America‚Äôs national principles and interests. This is why we have seen bipartisan outcry in the wake of evidence showing 12 UNRWA employees were directly involved in the barbaric Hamas attacks on October 7th, as well as the revelation that 1,200 UNRWA employees, 10% of its total workforce, are linked to terrorism. The United States and its allies must cut funding for UNRWA completely and permanently and find alternative mechanisms to meet the humanitarian needs of Palestinian civilians without undermining the security of Israelis.‚Äù

organizations.name: united nations relief and works ag

author: Bhutan's Daily Newspaper
title: Our carbon potential: Challenges and solutions | Kuensel Online
text:
Bhutan is known for pristine forests, clean rivers, and our carbon-negative status, and so, our carbon potential could unlock significant opportunities. Yet, challenges abound. The complexities of international carbon markets, governance limitations, and our unique development context all pose significant hurdles. To turn potential into profit, we must navigate these challenges strategically while maintaining its deep-rooted commitment to sustainability.
Our most immediate obstacle perhaps is access to international carbon markets. International carbon markets are governed by intricate regulations, requiring countries to meet strict compliance standards. For us, with limited experience in carbon trading, navigating these regulations demands expertise and robust infrastructure. Establishing monitoring, reporting, and verification (MRV) systems will be crucial. These systems can allow us to quantify its carbon emissions reductions or sequestrations and certify carbon credits for sale. However, MRV systems are both costly and complex, requiring not only financial investment but also skilled human resources.
Institutional capacity so is another challenge facing us . Effective governance frameworks and policies must be established to ensure transparency, accountability, and equity in carbon trading. We must build our capacity to manage carbon projects to ensure that government agencies, private sector players, and communities are all aligned. In the end, clear and efficient governance structures will be key to preventing inefficiencies, corruption, or unequal distribution of benefits from carbon trading.
The volatility of global carbon prices also poses a significant challenge. Carbon markets are subject to global economic conditions and shifts in international climate policies. For Bhutan, this unpredictability could mean unstable revenues from carbon credit sales. We must, therefore, diversify our carbon-related revenue streams, such as exploring nature-based solutions like afforestation, soil carbon sequestration, or even carbon capture technologies.
Our geographic and demographic constraints limit the scale of carbon projects. With 70 percent of our land under forest cover, we have limited scope for further afforestation projects. Expanding carbon projects without undermining the country‚Äôs existing environmental protections will require innovation. That would mean focussing on sustainable land management practices, community-based reforestation projects, and harnessing indigenous knowledge for ecosystem preservation.
One of the most significant challenges perhaps is the high cost of verification and monitoring. Ensuring that carbon emissions reductions are legitimate requires robust MRV systems. Bhutan will need to invest heavily in advanced technologies like satellite monitoring, artificial intelligence (AI), and blockchain for transparent and efficient verification.
While the challenges are many, solutions exist, and we must act swiftly to capitalise on our carbon potential. One practical solution is forging strategic partnerships. We can collaborate with international agencies, NGOs, and private companies with expertise in carbon trading, MRV systems, and climate financing for technical assistance, capacity-building, and financial support.
Another critical solution may lie in fostering community engagement. Carbon projects, particularly those related to forest conservation, must involve local communities to ensure long-term sustainability.
What is critically necessary is developing a national carbon market strategy that includes clear guidelines on how carbon credits will be generated, verified, and sold. It should also outline how revenues will be invested back into the country.

author: @le_parisien
title: Passage de la flamme olympique en Gironde : deux individus ¬´ issus de la mouvance islamiste ¬ª interpell√©s
text:
Passage de la flamme olympique en Gironde : deux individus ¬´ issus de la mouvance islamiste ¬ª interpell√©s
Le premier individu interpell√© en Gironde avait √©t√© condamn√© pour apologie du terrorisme, tandis que le second √©tait connu des services de renseignement pour des propos pro-djihadistes.
La suspicion r√®gne autour de
la flamme olympique. Ce vendredi, G√©rald Darmanin a annonc√© les interpellations de deux hommes ¬´ particuli√®rement surveill√©s, issus de la mouvance islamiste ¬ª, via un communiqu√©. La flamme √©tait de passage en Gironde ce vendredi.
Les deux individus ont ¬´ viol√© la mesure individuelle de contr√¥le administratif et de surveillance (MICAS) ¬ª d√©cid√©e √† leur encontre. Celle-ci permet de restreindre l‚Äôacc√®s d‚Äôun individu consid√©r√© comme ¬´ dangereux ¬ª √† certains secteurs sur une dur√©e d√©termin√©e.
¬´ Apologie publique du terrorisme ¬ª
¬´ Le premier individu, √¢g√© de 33 ans, a √©t√© condamn√© en janvier dernier pour apologie publique du terrorisme ¬ª, pr√©cise le communiqu√©. Le second, √¢g√© de 23 ans, ¬´ √©tait connu des services de renseignement pour des propos pro-djihadistes r√©p√©t√©s sur la voie publique. Il avait par ailleurs √©t√© condamn√© √† une peine d‚Äôemprisonnement ferme en octobre 2022 ¬ª. ¬´ Merci aux agents du minist√®re de l‚ÄôInt√©rieur pour leur mobilisation ¬ª, a √©crit G√©rald Darmanin sur X.
Mardi, un homme de 26 ans
avait d√©j√† √©t√© interpell√© pr√®s de Bordeaux deux jours avant le passage du relais de la flamme olympique, apr√®s avoir diffus√© un ¬´ message inqui√©tant ¬ª sur les r√©seaux sociaux. Le parquet avait annonc√© sa mise en examen. ¬´ Un individu planifiant une action violente lors du passage du relais de la flamme olympique √† Bordeaux a √©t√© interpell√© ¬ª, avait pr√©c√©demment affirm√© le ministre de l‚ÄôInt√©rieur sur X.
¬´ En garde √† vue, l‚Äôint√©ress√© a admis avoir envisag√© un passage √† l‚Äôacte, sans lieu d√©termin√©, suite √† une agression subie. Aucune r√©f√©rence √† la flamme olympique n‚Äôa √©t√© √©voqu√©e ¬ª, a cependant soulign√© la procureure de la R√©publique √† Bordeaux, Fr√©d√©rique Porterie, dans une communication √† la presse.
Selon Beauvau, 77 ¬´ Micas ¬ª sont en cours, un chiffre qui a fortement augment√© depuis le d√©but du relais de la flamme. Le minist√®re assure par ailleurs que les mesures d‚Äôentraves ¬´ continueront d‚Äô√™tre renforc√©es √† l‚Äôapproche des Jeux ¬ª.

author: EFE
title: Biden anunci√≥ 225 millones para Ucrania en reuni√≥n con Zelenski durante cumbre de la OTAN
text: Biden anunci√≥ 225 millones para Ucrania en reuni√≥n con Zelenski durante cumbre de la OTAN Tras el anuncio, el mandatario ucraniano, Volod√≠mir Zelenski, expres√≥ su gratitud a Biden por la ayuda, calific√°ndola como ‚Äúuna noticia muy fuerte‚Äù. El presidente de Estados Unidos, [Joe Biden,](https://www.wradio.com.co/tag/joseph_biden/a/) anunci√≥ este jueves 11 de julio un nuevo paquete de asistencia militar de 225 millones de d√≥lares para [Ucrania](https://www.wradio.com.co/tag/ucrania/a/) durante un encuentro con su hom√≥logo ucraniano, [Volod√≠mir Zelenski](https://www.wradio.com.co/tag/volodymyr_oleksandrovych_zelenskiy/a/), en el marco de la cumbre de la OTAN en Washington. Lea tambi√©n: ‚ÄúHoy me enorgullece anunciar un nuevo conjunto de sistemas de seguridad para Ucrania‚Äù, declar√≥ Biden junto a Zelenski ante los medios de comunicaci√≥n antes de la reuni√≥n. Seg√∫n explic√≥ el mandatario estadounidense, este es el octavo paquete que ha autorizado desde que el Congreso aprobara en abril una ayuda de 61.000 millones de d√≥lares, la cual lleg√≥ tras meses de debate por el bloqueo de los republicanos, lo que provoc√≥ una escasez de armamento en Ucrania. Tras el anuncio, Zelenski expres√≥ su gratitud a Biden por la ayuda, calific√°ndola como ‚Äúuna noticia muy fuerte‚Äù. ‚ÄúEstoy agradecido a usted, su equipo, su administraci√≥n, por supuesto, al Congreso, ambos partidos, ambas c√°maras y a todos los estadounidenses por su apoyo vital y firme a Ucrania y al pueblo ucraniano. Juntos, estamos salvando vidas‚Äù, afirm√≥ Zelenski, ataviado con su caracter√≠stica indumentaria verde oliva militar. El presidente ucraniano aprovech√≥ para mencionar ante las c√°maras el ataque del lunes perpetrado por Rusia contra el principal hospital infantil de [Kiev](https://www.wradio.com.co/tag/kiev/a/) y otras ciudades ucranianas, que caus√≥ al menos 41 v√≠ctimas civiles en la ofensiva a√©rea m√°s letal de los √∫ltimos meses. En relaci√≥n con este ataque, agradeci√≥ el env√≠o por parte de Estados Unidos, Alemania, Pa√≠ses Bajos, Ruman√≠a e Italia de sistemas de defensa a√©rea, incluyendo cuatro Patriot, en los pr√≥ximos meses, cumpliendo as√≠ una de las principales peticiones de Zelenski. Adem√°s de los sistemas antia√©reos, la transferencia prevista de cazas F-16 para Ucrania est√° en marcha y concluir√° este verano, anunci√≥ ayer el secretario de Estado estadounidense, [Antony Blinken](https://www.wradio.com.co/tag/antony_blinken/a/). En esta cumbre de la [ OTAN](https://www.wradio.com.co/2024/07/11/las-conclusiones-que-deja-la-cumbre-de-la-otan-en-washington/) en Washington, que conmemora el 75 aniversario de la alianza, los l√≠deres han mostrado su unidad en la defensa de Ucrania a largo plazo. Ayer, en la primera jornada, ya se comprometieron a enviar al menos otros 40.000 millones de euros (unos 36.922 millones de d√≥lares) de apoyo militar a Kiev el pr√≥ximo a√±o y declararon ‚Äúirreversible‚Äù su integraci√≥n en la organizaci√≥n, aunque evitaron fijar una fecha concreta y aseguraron que ocurrir√° cuando se den las condiciones adecuadas.

author: Getnews
title: Social Anxiety Coach Katy Morin Announces New Resources to Help
text: Social Anxiety Coach Katy Morin Announces New Resources to Help People Overcome Social Anxiety and Build Confidence Montreal, Canada - According to the Anxiety & Depression Association of America, approximately 15 million American adults [https://adaa.org/understanding-anxiety/facts-statistics] suffer from Social Anxiety Disorder. This reflects the pressing need for targeted support and resources for individuals dealing with this mental health issue. In response to this growing demand, Social Anxiety Antidote [https://www.socialanxietyantidote.com/] has introduced an innovative 3-month group coaching program. This initiative aims to empower individuals struggling with social anxiety by providing them with the necessary tools to overcome challenges and boost their confidence. Reports indicate that this program offers a blend of interactive programs and personalized coaching sessions. The curriculum is rooted in evidence-based practices and designed to accommodate different levels of need and commitment. It focuses on enhancing self-awareness, developing essential social skills, and cultivating a resilient mindset. This carefully tailored approach ensures that each participant receives a personalized experience, addressing the unique hurdles they face due to social anxiety. With Katy Morin at the helm, participants are guaranteed expert guidance as they embark on this transformative journey toward confidence and improved social interaction. According to Katy, this innovative platform is set to introduce a groundbreaking feature - Self-Hypnosis to Boost Confidence. This new addition is set to empower users by harnessing the transformative power of self-hypnosis, providing them with the tools to elevate their confidence levels and achieve personal milestones. Social Anxiety has also launched a new 1:1 Coaching Program [https://www.socialanxietyantidote.com/course/breakthrough]. The program is designed to provide personalized support and strategies to individuals struggling with social anxiety. It aims to offer a more individualized approach compared to the group sessions traditionally offered by the platform. "Our new resources provide individuals with the tools and strategies they need to not only manage social anxiety but to truly thrive in social settings, whether it's at work, school, or in personal relationships," explains Morin. "We know that social anxiety can be debilitating and isolating, but with the right support and guidance, individuals can learn to overcome their fears and lead fulfilling lives," She adds. During these private sessions, participants will receive tailored guidance and techniques based on their specific needs and objectives. Morin's method integrates hypnotherapy and personalized coaching to help individuals address their unique challenges, from improving social skills to managing anxiety triggers. This announcement is more than just the introduction of resources; it is a call to action for individuals to reclaim their right to confident social interactions. It underscores the importance of addressing mental health with the same urgency and dedication as physical health, emphasizing that social anxiety is not a life sentence but a challenge that can be overcome with the right support. About Social Anxiety Antidote: Social Anxiety Antidote is a platform dedicated to helping individuals overcome social anxiety. It offers personalized coaching and resources aimed at building confidence and facilitating comfortable social interactions. The platform emphasizes a non-judgmental approach and uses innovative techniques to support users in their journey towards social freedom and improved mental health. Media Contact Company Name: Social Anxiety Antidote Contact Person: Katy Morin Email: Send Email [http://www.universalpressrelease.com/?pr=social-anxiety-coach-katy-morin-announces-new-resources-to-help-people-overcome-social-anxiety-and-build-confidence] Country: Canada Website: https://www.socialanxietyantidote.com/about This release was published on openPR. Permanent link to this press release: Copy Please set a link in the press area of your homepage to this press release on openPR. openPR disclaims liability for any content contained in this release. You can edit or delete your press release Social Anxiety Coach Katy Morin Announces New Resources to Help People Overcome Social Anxiety and Build Confidence here News-ID: 3452779 ‚Ä¢ Views: ‚Ä¶ More Releases from Getnews [](/news/3452775/alex-bert-helping-couples-rediscover-love-and-rebuild) Alex Bert: Helping Couples Rediscover Love and Rebuild Relationships Alex Bert is a renowned breakup coach who has been transforming lives and relationships since 2005. Born in Tallinn, Estonia, Alex found his true calling in helping couples overcome challenges and reignite the love they once shared. London, United Kingdom - With a focus on helping people get their ex-partners back, he has helped over 180,000 clients worldwide to mend broken bonds, improve communication, and build stronger, more resilient partnerships. ‚Ä¶ [](/news/3452773/bistonia-estates-llc-review-of-the-italian-realty-market) Bistonia Estates LLC review of the Italian realty market Image: https://www.getnews.info/wp-content/uploads/2024/04/1712227454.png Property resorts in Tuscany leads the ranking of the most expensive cities in Italy. Bistonia Estates LLC analysis will help you assess the market prospects Bistonia Estates LLC analyzed 100 municipalities in Italy and ranked the most expensive and most sought-after cities in the country. The first place was taken by the resort town of Forte dei Marmi, which is located in Tuscany. About eight thousand people live there, and ‚Ä¶ [](/news/3452771/invisor-provides-standard-cma-usa-programs) Invisor Provides Standard CMA USA Programs Invisor, a leading finance and digital transformation-focused platform provides CMA USA programs in Kochi and Kerala. In the business world, knowing how to manage finances often requires training. Through standard and premium certification training platforms, people can be better equipped on how to handle business finances. Invisor is a reputable finance and digital transformation-oriented platform providing businesses with finance solutions. The finance and digital transformation-focused company also provides potential finance experts ‚Ä¶ [](/news/3452768/law-office-of-bartholomew-baffuto-provides-trusted-legal) Law Office of Bartholomew Baffuto Provides Trusted Legal Services in Defense of ‚Ä¶ Law Office of Bartholomew Baffuto, a top DUI law firm, provides effective and solution-oriented legal services in defense of driving while intoxicated cases. In New Jersey, the Law Office of Bartholomew Baffuto is a reputable DUI law firm providing effective legal representation. The DUI/DWI law firm has been in practice for years.
